cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses mechanism design and peer selection, which are topics commonly studied in the field of game theory (cs.GT). The authors also mention the use of algorithms and computer science techniques in peer selection, which suggests a potential fit for the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of crowdsourcing and voting mechanisms, which could fall under the social and information networks (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the authors mention the need for a truthful and unbiased mechanism, which could be related to the field of data science (cs.DS) and fairness in machine learning.
